actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent).
Referred to the Subcommittee on Investigations.

official_title: To amend the National Security Act of 1947 to revise the functions of the National Security Council and to add the Secretary of Commerce, the Secretary of the Treasury, and the United States Trade Representative to the statutory membership of the National Security Council.
subjects: Office of the U.S. Trade Representative

summary.text: National Security Council Amendments of 1992 - Amends the National Security Act of 1947 to: (1) include as a function of the National Security Council (Council) advising the President on the integration of foreign trade policies with the national security; (2) require cooperation between the military services and Federal departments and agencies in matters involving U.S. economic security; (3) delete from Council membership the Director for Mutual Security and the Chairman of the National Security Resources Board; and (4) add to Council membership the Secretaries of Commerce and the Treasury and the U.S. Trade Representative.

titles.title: To amend the National Security Act of 1947 to revise the functions of the National Security Council and to add the Secretary of Commerce, the Secretary of the Treasury, and the United States Trade Representative to the statutory membership of the National Security Council.
